More than two years have passed since, and the pace of Clickhouse development is not slowing down [https://github.com/ClickHouse/ClickHouse/pulse/monthly]: 800 merged PRs just during last month! This didn't blow your mind? Check out the full changelog,

item.title: dotnet-hash - BuiltWithDot.Net
item.description:
A simple `dotnet` global tool to calculate hashes for the given file.
The tool calculates MD5, SHA-1, SHA-256, SHA-384, and SHA-512 hashes for any file and outputs the result as Base64 or Hex string.

item.title: How to Read Assembly Language
item.description: Why, in 2021, does anyone need to learn about assembly language? First, reading assembly language is the way to know exactly what your program is doing. Why, exactly, is that C++ program 1 MiB (say) instead of 100 KiB? Is it possible to squeeze some more performance out of that function that gets called all the time? For C++ in particular, it is easy to forget or just not notice some operation (e.

item.title: Video Game Programming From Scratch with Casey Muratori - CoRecursive Podcast
item.description:
I'm not really a big gamer, but lately, I've fallen down this rabbit hole into the world of Casey Muratori, and this project that he started on Twitch in 2014. He is building a video game from scratch and explaining it all as he goes along.
Casey is a professional video game and game engine, creator. He has been doing it for over 30 years. His approach to development feels a little bit like it's from the 1970s. Yet, it resonates with many smart people who are learning how to truly build things and understand fundamentals from Casey.
Casey has a lesson about learning and teaching for us all. […]
item.author: (Adam Gordon Bell)

item.title: Creating a co_await awaitable signal that can be awaited multiple times, part 2 | The Old New Thing
item.description: Last time, we created an awaitable signal that can be awaited multiple times. We noted that one problem with the implementation is that the object couldn’t be copied: Everybody has to await the same object, which can create lifetime issues. One way of solving this is to put the awaitable_event inside a shared_ptr and having everybody share the lifetime.
item.author: (Raymond Chen Follow)

item.title: Deploy a Docker image to an Azure Container Instance
item.description: This article discuss about how to Deploy a Docker image to an Azure Container Instance. Azure Container Instance aka ACI helps you to run your Docker image in Azure. So to deploy the Docker image to Azure, first you need publish your Docker image to a container registry then you can connect the Container Instance to the registry and deploy the image.

item.title: BDTest - BuiltWithDot.Net
item.description:
BDTest is a testing framework. It can be used with other frameworks (such as MSTest, xUnit or NUnit) or standalone.
It is designed to structure your tests in a behaviour driven testing way. Tests must consist of a Given (Setup), When (Action being tested) and Then (Assertions) step.
